chapter.title: Functions
chapter.para: For each trade type (product), there is a module that enables you to initiate, amend, and monitor trades on behalf of your company.
All these modules have the same set of functions. These functions are described in this chapter.
For basic features common to all modules, such as basic terminology and the behaviour of lists, see chapters Introduction and Getting Started.

section.title: Portlets
section.para: The Recent Pending Transactions list within the Trade Events portlet on your home page shows recent events in all modules. This portlet is provided by the module.

section.title: Validation and Submission
section.para: Several types of validation are done when you fill in an input form.
First, each field is validated as you enter it. Errors that can be detected by local validation of the field are indicated by a popup message as soon as the cursor leaves the field.

When you have completed a form and you click Submit, the form is checked to ensure that all mandatory fields are filled in. If not, you get an error message and the first uncompleted mandatory field is highlighted.
If you click on Populate defaults, no fields are mandatory.

Once all mandatory fields are filled in (if any), Populate defaults or Submit sends the form to the back-office software for more detailed validation. If any errors are detected, you get a message box with the text "A validation error has occurred" and a More> link.
Click More> to see a list of the errors. The first few lines may be general error messages such as "Failed to execute request" and "Failed to validate ...". The actual error messages then follow.

At certain points in filling in a form, you can click a button (for example, Pay Schedule on some forms) to cause an action for which data has to be sent to the back-office software. This too gives you the message box if any errors are detected.

If you clicked Populate defaults and no errors are found, the back-office software returns your form after setting any derived fields that can be calculated from the data you entered. No message is given; your updated form is simply reloaded.

If you clicked Submit and no errors are found, the back-office software assigns a bank reference to your trade. You get the Submit trade-type Initiation page, which displays the message "Your trade-type with Bank Reference number has been successfuly submitted". You should make a note of the bank reference.

section.title: Main Menu
section.para: The main menu of is down the left-hand side of your home page. It has the heading Trade Applications. It consists of links to the menus for the individual modules.
The number of items on the main menu therefore depends on which modules you have permissions for.

section.title: Functions
section.para: You enter the menu for a module by clicking the appropriate link on the main menu on your home page. On the menu for each module are the functions listed in this section.

All the functions in these modules handle only trades of the type handled by the current module. In many cases the name of the function or set of functions is followed by the name of the asset type handled by the module. For example, in the Swap module, the menu item shown here as Enter is Enter Swap.
Where it is necessary to include the trade type we call it trade-type. Thus, in the Swap module, trade-type is Swap. The individual functions are described in the rest of this chapter.

listitem.para: Set of functions for creating a request to initiate a trade, and submitting it to the bank.
Set of functions for creating a request to amend a trade, and submitting it to the bank.
Function to display a list of your company's pending transactions; that is, those that are have Draft or Unsigned status. You can open transactions to edit or submit them.
Function to display a list of your company's files, so you can view their details and optionally print a hard copy of these details.
Set of functions to carry out maintenance tasks, including deleting outdated transactions.

section.title: Operations
section.para: Most functions display a form, with buttons which you click after filling it in. These buttons are as follows. These buttons do not all appear on every form.

entry.para: Operation

If you do not have sufficient permissions (for example, to handle the amount you have requested), you get an error message and the transaction is not sent. Its status becomes Unsigned.

section.title: "Enter" Functions
section.para: The Enter part of the menu contains functions for creating a trade initiation and submitting it to the bank.

section.title: New Trade
section.para: Create a trade initiation from scratch and optionally send it to the bank. You can alternatively save it as a template, from which such initiations can be created.

This function displays the New trade-type (for example, New Swap) input form. You use this form to create your initiation and validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it as a template.
The input form is different for each trade type. For detailed descriptions of these input forms, see the chapters for the individual trade types.

section.title: From Template
section.para: Create a trade initiation from a template and optionally submit it to the bank.
This function displays a list of initiation templates created by users in your company.

Click in the Reference column to display the New trade-type input form, initialised with the data from the template. You use this form to create your initiation and validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it again as a template.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: Continue working on a trade initiation that you or another user have already started and saved.
This function displays a list of Draft or Unsigned trade initiations created by users in your company.

Click in the System Id column to open the initiation in a New trade-type input form for further editing, after which you can again validate it, save it as a draft, submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority), or save it as a template.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Submit to the bank a trade initiation that you or another user have previously started but been unable to submit.
This function displays a list of Unsigned trade initiations created by users in your company.

Click in the System Id column to display a read-only summary of the initiation, from where you can submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority). You cannot edit the initiation from this function.

You can submit multiple initiations in a single operation directly from the list. Click the box at the beginning of a row to select the row, then click Submit at the end of the list to submit all the selected initiations. The system will check that you have authorisation for multiple submissions.

section.title: Bank Notification
section.para: The Bank Notification part of the menu contains functions for creating an amendment to an existing trade, and submitting the amendment to the bank.

section.title: Current
section.para: Create an update for an existing trade, and optionally submit it to the bank.

This function displays a list of your company's existing trades - that is, those that have been approved by the bank. This includes any that have been entered directly into the back office software, not only those entered via Summit Portal.
Click in the Bank Reference column to open an input form.You use this form to create your update and save it as a draft or submit it to the bank (if you have sufficient authority).
You cannot open a trade ftom this list if its status is Cancelled.

The input form initially displayed is a short one, the same in all modules. It has a field where you select the type of update you want to make. Once you have done this, the form is extended to display some or all of the fields from the New trade-type input form, as required for the update. The short input form is described in detail at the end of this Bank Notification section.

section.title: Retrieve Draft
section.para: Continue working on an update that you or another user have already started and saved.
This function displays a list of Draft and Unsigned updates created by users in your company.
Click in the Bank Reference column to open the update for further editing, after which you can save it again, or submit it (if you have sufficient authority).

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Submit to the bank an update that you or another user have previously started but been unable to submit.
This function displays a list of Unsigned updates created by users in your company.
Click in the System Id column to display a read-only summary of the update, from where you can submit it to the bank if you have sufficient authority. You cannot edit the update from this function.

section.title: "Update Existing Trade-type" Form
section.para: This is the detailed description of the input form displayed by the Bank Notification > Current Trade-type function.

entry.para: Identification number of the trade. Automatically generated by the system. Read only field. (Example: ES1102000874)
Current state of the trade, as described in section Inquiry later in this chapter.
Revision number of the trade. A new trade is version 1, a trade that has has one update is version 2, and so on.
Name/number of the Customer.
Default is Bank of New York Mellon Group. Read only field.

row.entry: Type of update to be made. Select from the dropdown list. The list of available actions depends on the trade status in the Bank Status field..When you select an action, the form is extended with fields appropriate to the type of update you are making.

section.title: Inquiry and Maintenance
section.para: This section describes the inquiry and maintenance functions found in the Pending, Inquiry, and Maintenance parts of the menu.
First we describe the Output Format field, common to several of these functions.

section.title: Output Format
section.para: Some functions in this part of the menu have a feature to let you choose the destination and format of the lists they display.
Below the search criteria fields is an Output Format field, where you select the destination and format from a dropdown list:

listitem.para: Screen (default) displays the list on the same web page, in the normal list format.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report, so you can use it or customize it in your office productivity tools. When you click Search, the browser displays the File Download prompt, where you can choose to save the file or open it. Opening it launches Excel if it is available on your workstation.

section.title: Pending
section.para: Check the status of pending transactions, and optionally edit or submit them.
This function displays a list of your company's transactions that are pending - that is Draft or Unsigned.
The Type column in the list shows the type of transaction:
The Status column shows the current state of the transaction:
After the transaction has been sent, it is no longer pending, so will no longer appear in this list.
Each transaction is shown with one or two action icons, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Open the transaction to edit it (same as selecting it in Retrieve Draft). This button is present on transactions with Draft status.
Open the transaction in non-editable form to submit it to the bank (same as selecting it in Retrieve Unsigned). This buttons is present on transactions with Unsigned status.

section.title: Inquiry
section.para: Check the status, details and history of trades.
This function displays a list of files (that is, the set of transactions on one trade) that your company has initiated.

The Status column shows the current state of the trade. It should not be confused with the status (Draft or Unsigned) of individual transactions. It has many possible values - a few examples are: Pending, Cancelled, Pending Save, Pending Full Termination, Done, Verified, etc etc.

Click the
icon by an entry to display a popup window showing the details of the trade.

section.title: Maintenance
section.para: The functions in this part of the menu carry out various maintenance tasks.

section.title: Set Entity
section.para: Only present if your company has entities.
Assign an entity to a file (that is, the set of transactions on one trade) that currently has none.

This function displays a list of transactions that have no entity assigned. Click in the System Id column to open a form where you can assign an entity. All transactions of the selected file are updated.
No particular permissions are needed for this action.

section.title: Unsigned
section.para: Delete Draft or Unsigned transactions that are out of date and will never be submitted.
This function displays a list of Draft or Unsigned transactions.

Click rows to select them (click anywhere in the row - it becomes highlighted), then click Delete selected transactions at the end of the list to delete them. The system will check that you have sufficient authorisation.

note.para: Deleted records are physically removed from the system. This should therefore be done with great care!
